document.title: Georgia’s K-12 Standards for English Language Arts (SY2025-2026)

44869D87DA754FE5938C577E5546000C.description: Use basic parenthetical citations to credit the source used. (C)

DDAB4E7C16C1461695D01AA4104808C1.description: Determine credibility and relevance by assessing the strengths and weaknesses of source texts to support a topic or message. (I)

AAFCB3833AC44FB9926C99736072A0D1.description: Refer to specific passages or quotations from a text to support an idea, answer, or opinion, recording the referenced information’s page number. (I)

0FA509A2042C4DE7813209F4A38D119E.description: Curating Sources & Evidence Integrate evidence from print and digital sources, assessing credibility and relevance and avoiding plagiarism.

6A2819C2CB3A4F1797726A5B36124109.description: Consider and integrate information from research, including relevant and accurate evidence from two or more credible sources. (C)

2AFB36B11DEA43E1BB3E33C58ED789C9.description: Conduct research by locating, gathering, curating, and integrating information from multiple credible sources, including print, digital, and personal communication, about a self-selected topic. (I)

7AC65F91B73B4492ACB0115DFEA59535.description: Generate questions about a self-selected topic of interest to be researched, asking probing questions to compare and contrast related topics. (I)

EE09D274CC704A92B74DABDF185086A3.description: Research & Inquiry Conduct research to ask and answer questions that clarify, deepen, and extend understanding of a topic of interest using credible sources and communicating relevant and accurate information.

EA6C30B242E14A8B8D48CD657D0B8B22.description: Research & Analysis Students use, discuss, analyze, and curate texts as they engage in various conversations, activities, and projects about a range of grade-level texts and topics.

8A5087CEB04343F7A6E0D84FE24689E8.description: Apply poetic techniques (e.g., rhyme, rhyme scheme, structure) to produce different types of poetry (e.g., free verse, rhymed verse, haiku, limerick). (C)

A2BE7A8969F34E2AA87087D1EA2D5AAB.description: Discuss and explain techniques used to present and design poetry, including rhyme and structure. (I)

BD6855C001C44EDD9CC1516E3D34E61C.description: Poetic Techniques Explain, analyze, and use poetic techniques to shape understandings.

F20BA07BFE1C4871BFE6B2A802C6C09C.description: Apply opinion techniques to create opinion pieces that introduce the topic, state an opinion about the topic, supply reasons and evidence to support the opinion with linking words (e.g., because, therefore, since, for example) to connect the opinion and reasons, and provide a concluding statement or section. [This progression resumes as argumentative techniques in 6th grade; students will reinforce skills during 5th grade.] (C)

CF677E4F109F4CE1BBB684715BD66506.description: Discuss and evaluate techniques used to present and design opinion and argumentative texts, including author’s opinion or claim, supporting reasons, and evidence. (I)

1546A29BB8D849D58A8A8DF51377FBCA.description: Opinion Techniques Explain, analyze, and use opinion techniques to shape understandings.

8DF3E82E94A948EBBA4387E5F187A371.description: Apply expository techniques that clearly introduce a topic, group paragraphs or sections to develop the topic with facts and other information (e.g., definitions, concrete details, quotations), use precise language, and provide a concluding statement or section. (C)

9157FA68FD6D410AAE35AF0CC8536D81.description: Compare and contrast first and secondhand accounts of the same event or topic using primary and/or secondary sources. (I)

31F2D973DDA040009254CAD7D9A0A5A6.description: Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text based on specific information in the text. (I)

4DB54D073B594FE4B6E7800A470CF833.description: Discuss and evaluate techniques used to present and design expository texts, including multiple main ideas, facts, and key details used to support the main idea. (I)

78186B30132940D4BAEB86486F07926A.description: Expository Techniques Explain, analyze, and use expository techniques to shape understandings.

19C58CE27E79437E8372AC1791099A6F.description: Apply narrative techniques (e.g., character, setting, conflict, climax, resolution, and dialogue) to develop a real or imagined experience using descriptive details, clear event sequences, and a conclusion. (C)

814E2A726E3B480EA5BB9150817F4C00.description: Compare and contrast stories in the same genre (e.g., mysteries, adventures) from diverse cultures on their approaches to similar themes and topics. (I)

2808930D16F44A909B90672EEA729631.description: Explain how a theme is demonstrated through a character’s growth or conflict resolution. (I)

B492852489A54F26AE1050793E311CD1.description: Analyze how setting, events, conflict, and characterization contribute to the plot. (I)

B5A3B3F9C81D4BE2BE1270303F8DA6F2.description: Analyze the use of narrative techniques to present ideas, design texts, and convey information about characters, setting, and plot. (I)

1E939D06B90B4614A36756F584FF11C0.description: Narrative Techniques Explain, analyze, and use narrative techniques to shape understandings.

1A99D8573C3144C0AA22409AAA0A518C.description: Techniques Students explain, analyze, and use various techniques to comprehend and shape meaning.

403697C9FA5648E69F6BCF20C49CD753.description: Use figurative language for intentional effects when expressing ideas or conveying information. (C)

BC1CA9D8C16642878F7FA80C634DF0BA.description: Describe the impact of the use of figurative language such as similes, metaphors, idioms, hyperboles, and personification in response to audience and purpose, in various modes and genres. (I)

29A1DC9AC9904690A271C5645B561F2C.description: Craft Use language to interpret meaning and craft engaging texts.

0C2015AA022E4BD28378303585FD9CB7.description: Craft related ideas into coherent paragraphs that follow a logical structure using transitions. (C)

340CCD6D65DE4E2F8447C5877C646B1A.description: Use conjunctions and transition words or phrases, such as similarly and in contrast, to show relationships between ideas and information. (C)

C51B61D9C2564AC998DBC33FEE3428D9.description: Design texts using a variety of text structures and features, according to purpose and audience. (C)

EF1F5AE9C31740A2AE8B5E21B5DDAA31.description: Describe how text features (e.g., chapter titles, diagrams) and organizational structure (e.g., chapters, problem/solution) function in conjunction to represent ideas and information coherently in texts. (I)

C0D8F3334F784E38891022B9264AD517.description: Organization Demonstrate and apply understanding of organizational structures and elements to create cohesive and engaging texts.

7B443696A93E4B8CAF87AFD1907F4EAC.description: Structure & Style Students build and apply knowledge about language and organizational structures and elements used to convey and arrange ideas and information in texts.

378A9D541F2F4B82B687A75335313D1E.description: Make inferences about the context in which the text is written (e.g., time period, individual, situational). (I)

F76CB60F10AC4A1F9F8DC67BBA71E97F.description: Describe how a narrator or speaker’s perspective influences the text. (I)

7D5F5A744EEF4D51B7B7F7D9474F9AB9.description: Authors & Speakers Make connections between authors of texts, speakers in texts, varying perspectives, and the circumstances in which texts are produced.

2B14B97BBBE8411A95097345FA5AF7E8.description: Create multimodal texts, using features of pre-selected modes for a specific purpose and audience. (C)

90EC2E28CF81469980D59EC38EA8C3D0.description: Classify various texts by mode and describe how the author's choice of mode influences audiences and contributes to the overall purpose and effect. (I)

ED1521C185E548FBB3701FC937694710.description: Determine audience and explain multiple purposes found across a text. (I)

057A5FE617CD4541B3BCB113AA828ACE.description: Purpose & Audience Use knowledge of purposes and audiences, as well as the language that develops those relationships, to make meaning of texts in multiple modes.

60C192FF7CFA4BA189453C1D135F9976.description: Context Students describe the influences of purpose and audience on texts.

A8BE305A51D64F66B3E819790E4E94B2.description: Texts (T) Students grow in their learning as they purposefully engage with texts.

DA8AB33A81ED40A7BF57CB2A55998F8F.description: Use knowledge of word relationships and learned vocabulary words and phrases to make precise word choices when speaking and writing. (C)

9506497518E747EC98B7319FBC0F6AD4.description: Use print and digital reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses) to check spelling and determine or clarify the precise meaning of words and phrases. (I)

6069DDFB7A8B44A781EE74BB358A95D0.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among related words, including verbs, adjectives, and/or adverbs, to clarify intended meaning. (I)

13C3D6CED86A45F99086D274C7D1B949.description: Identify analogies and use synonyms, antonyms, homophones, and homographs to clarify intended meaning. (I)

BE859FEE52A947EC8EED29D02CF94510.description: Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and comparisons in text) to determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases. (I)

B74E47CBC2C546EDB49671302805E34B.description: Meaning & Purpose Make connections between words and phrases and use reference materials to determine or clarify word meanings in a variety of settings and for a variety of purposes.

A8DF245B127D485E82DEF797FFB7CB74.description: Construct words using knowledge of Greek and Latin roots, root words, and affixes. (C)

E278BAAC032C41C4B10243F684677655.description: Explain the connection between roots, root words, affixes, and parts of speech to determine the meaning of words (e.g., discuss as a verb vs. discussion as a noun). (I)

CA6A84BE9BE64EA7A9982017E3ACC911.description: Deconstruct words using knowledge of Greek and Latin roots, root words, and affixes to determine meaning. (I)

6FA574B40F134266B959B9EA91FE6904.description: Word Analysis Acquire and apply word analysis skills to determine the meanings of words and to communicate with precision in a variety of settings.

DABAA706A11543DCB239EAE54AD0EBB8.description: Use grade-level general, academic, and specialized vocabulary words and phrases to enhance communication in a variety of settings. (C)

D5657D8B870F4841887E127B263467FF.description: Acquire a range of general, academic, and specialized vocabulary words and phrases through grade-level texts and content. (I)

509E5F139015466DB712D384EE4CE1C7.description: General, Academic, & Specialized Vocabulary Acquire and use general, academic, and specialized vocabulary words and phrases with precision in a variety of settings.

8C691B2F7EC24AF69F30EFE2E18BE311.description: Vocabulary (V) Students engage in a wide range of written and spoken activities during which they expand and deepen their vocabularies, build word analysis skillsets (morphology), and determine or clarify the meanings of words and phrases.

66B5A433217F4DE194804CD0A3F1BF79.description: Elaborate on ideas and information, using adjectives and adverbs when incorporating details and descriptions to convey precise meaning and engage audiences. (C)

E77BF1D7F5BA4875B0F683878D0514F9.description: Use correct subject-verb agreement to consistently achieve clarity in a variety of sentences. (C)

28AEB2BA93804EDAA64F4A227FCD109D.description: Use a variety of simple, compound, and complex sentences to strengthen clarity and coherence, maintaining consistent verb tense throughout the entire text. (C)

A0048DB163DB4780B924C6852BFD661A.description: Apply understandings of sentence structure to comprehend a wide variety of grade-level texts. (I)

D2E1915BDB684364B6BF3E8EDE71CF1E.description: Syntax Apply understandings of sentence structure to comprehend and compose varied sentences.

51230ABE57304889B8226D7D44F7E416.description: Mechanics: Use conventional capitalization, quotation marks, commas, end punctuation, and parentheses (citations) when incorporating textual evidence. (Introduce)

AE8B4D5080FC490DB102AABFAB8238F1.description: Mechanics: Use semicolons to separate items in a series or list when at least one of the items already contains commas. (Introduce)

2659A245195E4806BADAEA634F69CBBA.description: Mechanics: Use conventional capitalization, quotation marks, commas, end punctuation, and attributions to indicate exact words and lines of dialogue. (Introduce)

733D451655634C1B81ED1905F44BF334.description: Grammar: Use correlative conjunctions to join words, phrases, or clauses. (Introduce)

BCD4B6146FB1433F90E4D8C2FA93C72C.description: Usage: Recognize and correct vague pronoun references. (Continue)

55455337167C412CA65AC527E2A9FCC5.description: Grammar: Form and use the progressive, perfect, and perfect progressive verb aspects. (Continue)

46EEF81A6E494FBCA01D4C358FF5067C.description: Mechanics: Use conventional capitalization and underlining, quotation marks, or italics to indicate titles of works. (Master)

0FB31F31F31749BA9F3483003CD1FD22.description: Mechanics: Use commas after introductory phrases or clauses. (Master)

6B468C628FB34380A2D753415A8B65B2.description: Grammar: Use subordinating conjunctions to join clauses. (Master)

4396B8B3077448B19C248E9FD7E833E2.description: "Grammar: Use indefinite pronouns, ensuring correct agreement. (Master)

FBB3F41467A845C2873A0CDB809B09A6.description: Grammar, Usage, & Mechanics Learn and apply conventions of Standard English grammar, usage, and mechanics to aid the comprehension and analysis of texts and to communicate clearly and precisely in written and spoken language.

60A8F589166E49B0B18B568BA1E836D7.description: Grammar Conventions Students observe, analyze, and use the structures and conventions of Standard English grammar, usage, and mechanics as they interpret and construct texts.

B6537D965C5F42D88975A3FBE48A4D8C.description: Language (L) Students learn and apply the structures and conventions of standard English. Students observe and analyze how grammar works in reading and writing. Students build vocabularies and determine word meanings as they relate to reading and writing.

700081C1C92E4A939690935A0B0F23F9.description: Build background knowledge by reciting all or part of significant poems and speeches as appropriate by grade level. (I/C)

267804EBE7A144F98E89EFD0A78DF82B.description: Engage in dialogue with audiences by asking and answering questions. (I/C)

AA1959BD35964ABAA1E83A145F97C188.description: Vary tone, pace, and nonverbal gestures as appropriate to purpose and audience. (I/C)

840ABC7A748246D08C8C325F96EBFFB0.description: Integrate modes and genres most appropriate to purpose and audience. (I/C)

ED224E5FE3294274AF7DF2E97224ADC2.description: Communicate clearly to present ideas, information, and texts. (I/C)

E61529753773497E8E4AE75292EC1221.description: Presentation Use presentation skills to tailor communication to target audiences for specific purposes.

0B4E3E88EDF74B03B483BC8DC7F60719.description: Work with others to discuss topics, investigate questions, solve problems, and explore and create texts. (I/C)

C4DE960E70284835A20DB7F6DF1F0294.description: Contribute to discussions and shared projects by offering ideas, listening to the ideas of others, and providing feedback. (I/C)

7B269D729A94487890813B56D2DDC9E2.description: Collaborate with others to determine group norms, establish goals and procedures, and facilitate productivity when working on shared projects. (I/C)

1C0DA23AAA824F2DB1FA6E42A13D26BE.description: Arrive to group discussions and collaborative meetings prepared to be an active participant in the work. (I/C)

16173A25C56544F694F111A430801CCB.description: Collaboration Collaborate with others to accomplish shared goals and projects.

F4C3FAB5950D48BDB9BDB278CC0E47A9.description: Collaboration & Presentation Students build and share knowledge as they engage with others in a range of settings and for a variety of purposes.

F2F0C8F9456147CBAF98F0743E15CD5D.description: Consume and produce multimodal texts, integrating a variety of genres, text features, and craft techniques to influence target audiences and achieve specific purposes. (I/C)

13CE30FE59F343D19C9A13D713A03927.description: Apply knowledge of how mode and genre impact how ideas and information are structured and arranged in texts. (I/C)

E91EE192E4764690A0253671F5628843.description: Apply knowledge of how mode and genre impact what kinds of ideas and information are included in texts. (I/C)

6D579952B46947648BCD7FECB5E48400.description: Explore and create texts in various modes and genres, developing and applying knowledge of how specific features impact meaning, tone, style, purpose, and audience. (I/C)

3403FEBFA18643A5832757A20898761E.description: Text Design Consider the impact of text design on audience and purpose when consuming and producing texts across modes and genres.

33FE8C27591C41A98F22FD0758298EC2.description: Organize texts by incorporating specific formats, structures, patterns, and features to influence the audience, facilitate accessibility, and support the text’s purpose. (I/C)

CCFB0A9632CF406BA69D19AFE533E239.description: Make decisions about sentence structure and syntax in order to accommodate and influence the audience and achieve a specific purpose. (I/C)

72799235E38F471C98FC6DBD343FC3FB.description: Craft words and phrases in order to influence the responses, thoughts, decisions, and questions of the target audience and achieve a specific purpose. (I/C)

E1A9334E70CB4925B6A799E29D657A85.description: Integrate literary, expository, and opinion (grades K-5) or rhetorical (grades 6-12) elements to appeal to target audiences and achieve specific purposes. (I/C)

DF51997344364D74B7B470641D540458.description: Writing like a Reader Construct texts with the audience’s experience in mind, basing decisions about craft techniques on context and purpose.

DFBC01DB14DF4C6BA5F9375CBD99E4B1.description: Describe, analyze, and evaluate the design and organization of the text, explaining how specific formats, structures, patterns, and features influence the audience, contribute to the text’s accessibility, and support the text’s purpose. (I/C)

84B1BE3ACEE04E1891093036D6102245.description: Explain, analyze, and evaluate how the author’s use of sentence structure and syntax affects the target audience and supports the text’s purpose. (I/C)

9F0A0F622F17439BA789421027C0D7E1.description: Identify, apply, and analyze important, interesting, or effective uses of language, explaining or evaluating how specific word choices affect the target audience and support the text’s purpose. (I/C)

B4FE1FC3C7C24FAF88CA211E95282356.description: Identify, apply, and analyze the literary, expository, and opinion (grades K-5) or rhetorical (grades 6-12) elements in texts, explaining or evaluating how specific elements affect the target audience and support the text’s purpose. (I/C)

F23DB32970C34EA5AC9F45B50E10B880.description: Reading like a Writer Interpret texts through the author’s lens by identifying, analyzing, and evaluating craft techniques that are connected to the responses, thoughts, decisions, and questions triggered by the text.

346D204F64BC4148964229594F3694DA.description: Author’s Craft Students apply knowledge of author’s craft to enhance the interpretation and construction of texts.

2265360E866345EB989B3342C45F647A.description: Draw from knowledge of how authors consider context and audience to determine which information and ideas to highlight, which text design is most accessible, which word choices and language structures are most effective, and which craft techniques are most impactful. (I/C)

6BEDEA765A6A42E2A709B6E406AE5ECF.description: Draw from knowledge of author, audience, and context to discern and establish a clear point of view or unique perspective when interpreting and constructing texts. (I/C)

8F61BD5CD7A54166AABC55255620AA76.description: Develop and apply knowledge of author, audience, and context to discern and establish the purpose of texts being interpreted or constructed and to evaluate the extent to which those texts achieve those purposes. (I/C)

164FA1AAB2B54312A13039A1659EFC30.description: Author, Audience, & Purpose Interpret and construct texts by developing and applying knowledge of the strategies and techniques authors use to accommodate the target audience and achieve the text’s purpose.

110E69C42ED24BB4B14FC4242ED3B5EC.description: Explore how context shapes the author’s decisions and the audience’s responses during the interpretation and construction of texts. (I/C)

11509137DDF44346953C38CE88FA2991.description: Consider how context impacts the purposes of the author and the audience. (I/C)

2F84D357AA68406F8BF75FFF8BE39CF3.description: Use prior knowledge, formal or informal research, and discussions with others to identify the key components of context that are most relevant. (I/C)

987A6A6231F44438B08155329600EF12.description: Context Develop and apply knowledge of key components of context such as background information, geographic location, cultural influences, time period, and contemporary events when interpreting and constructing texts.

0D3C0C956DE54DE18CFCA594F0FE19CF.description: Situating Texts Students develop and apply a multilayered understanding of context, author, audience, and purpose to ground and propel the interpretation and construction of texts.

D0A63020AFAC46A38A41584D0CD68049.description: Edit the text, ensuring it adheres to the conventions of written language. (C)

4AF4E7D221CF41B297FAE36DB7588EF8.description: Make changes to the text based on self-evaluation or external feedback, revising the organization, ideas, information, word choices, and craft techniques in order to increase the text’s effectiveness. (C)

71316511204A4AE4B2659FEE4C5AB6C0.description: Evaluate the text’s effectiveness based on self-review or feedback from others, determining whether the text matches the purpose and goals for writing. (C)

39634E7039424519991183C391F5E254.description: Construct an initial draft by integrating ideas and information; selecting words, phrases, and sentences; and incorporating craft techniques that will best achieve the purpose of the text and resonate with the target audience. (C)

E905E3F8BD3945F2A661950241D7CDF8.description: Link ideas and information to the organization plan, highlighting ideas and information that are most relevant, useful, and impactful. (C)

139CC568042A4B539FBD380941217F67.description: Generate ideas for content by assessing prior knowledge, gathering information from texts, and engaging in discussions with others. (C)

E23CF3AA3E244592842D9FE2E84E0377.description: Plan how to organize the text by selecting modes, genres, and structures that will achieve the purpose and meet the needs of the target audience. (C)

98090FC859E3481FA31322AE0DD65CC5.description: Establish a purpose and goals for writing and identify a target audience. (C)

524B6F16BF654A0283B091E592AE2CAE.description: Writing Processes Compose a range of texts for a variety of purposes and audiences, flexibly engaging in writing processes to plan, draft, evaluate, revise, and edit texts.

F5F8EF0CC65044E7A7A91277691DBD04.description: Determine the meanings of unfamiliar words and concepts by applying knowledge of context and of academic vocabulary and word parts. (I)

A12DADB4DB584701A52DEF542CECD874.description: Make, track, and support inferences about different levels of meaning within the text. (I)

6E5028FF9D9647679203B630E830F9BE.description: Make and track predictions about the events and information likely to come next. (I)

998EBBAD466B4A20B889567E44DABDB0.description: Summarize and visualize sections of the text to maintain understanding. (I)

399DC36D076C42CF94623895888FA038.description: Draw from, compare, build, and integrate prior knowledge with the material in the text, addressing inconsistencies or gaps and adding to knowledge repertoires as appropriate. (I)

98D80ED22BDF42E8913C8F4EC7EFE1C3.description: Scan and skim the text, making note of structures and sections that might be most useful. (I)

A41758BB25CD4FACA31764E5CC0068A2.description: Establish a purpose and set goals for reading, monitor comprehension, and adjust as needed. (I)

AD59C9D3227346F7A4644C173F7B583A.description: Comprehension Strategies Engage with a range of complex texts for a variety of tasks and purposes, accessing and using strategies for comprehension* before, during, and after reading as part of the meaning-making process.

F45B159C105242A981F35A7190EF352E.description: Consume and produce texts in order to solve problems or influence decisions. (I/C)

07EBFA32DC7B429B80BE06B716D106DC.description: Interpret and construct texts to aid the analysis and evaluation of texts and ideas. (I/C)

ACECFC2E7A96423FBA3F16003EEB454C.description: Explain and learn concepts and processes by interpreting and constructing texts. (I/C)

35C6DA7A85904DF793EC6DFC54A46EDC.description: Make use of texts to build knowledge, develop skills, make informed decisions, and share information and ideas. (I/C)

FEB958E414704F6B89EBEB3F217F4DFE.description: Share real or imagined experiences by interpreting and constructing texts that tell or include stories. (I/C)

00E664E56ACE4185AF83CEBC111C732E.description: Engagement & Intention Engage in written or spoken dialogue as author and audience for a variety of tasks and purposes, making intentional connections within, between, and beyond texts.

E8AC68A27EDF45E3BA59E401BD2D2D49.description: Develop independence and autonomy as a reader and writer. (I/C)

E564ED1455BE4F42A077F453599D6CEE.description: Participate in a community of readers and writers by developing group norms, discussing texts, sharing individual writing, listening as others share their writing, and offering and responding to feedback. (I/C)

46239158BF9C4F158B2EC18BBB9FF123.description: Build a repertoire of comprehension and composition skills, strategies, and techniques, drawing from them as needed to aid the interpretation and construction of texts. (I/C)

8237082E7A804B9BABA6C8831960FA1E.description: Select, read, and write texts of personal interest and academic relevance to grade-level texts and topics. (I/C)

D7D2C9261F9749F287C31A6E43A039D8.description: Discuss or write about personal and academic reading and writing preferences, referring to specific techniques, topics, modes, and genres that resonate most. (I/C)

4E5AAA13AD58495CB3B5C5530A065364.description: Generate, understand, monitor, and discuss personal and academic reading and writing goals, revising as appropriate. (I/C)

43316E2957654BEAAA988D84A633BB3A.description: Reader & Writer Identity Build an identity as a reader and writer, developing a repertoire of resources and tools to continuously expand participation as an active consumer and producer of texts.

E5ADFC9F86654178ADD55A56E425CC93.description: Engagement & Intention for Comprehension & Composition Students develop personal and academic identities as readers and writers, approaching texts for a variety of tasks and purposes and engaging in reading and writing processes in order to deepen comprehension and strengthen composition.

489FBFE508914785920333A422406018.description: Practices (P) Students engage routinely in four literacy practices that ground, shape, and inform the expectations of the Foundations, Language, and Texts domains.

BA60EDD4ED2845E3A1ADF1857D3C45A4.description: Use appropriate spacing throughout the body of a text when writing in cursive.

093ABB93BAD341CC86C6048D3272DA86.description: Produce texts using cursive writing legibly and efficiently.

D4DE7838008641A78DF0B85170DBB518.description: Write Cursive Use fine motor skills to form legible letters and words in cursive.

FEDC73A706654F0786E51D0E6A242CDB.description: Read a variety of texts written in cursive.

E752723CE8584C8A89EA465497D0050E.description: Read Cursive Read texts written in cursive.

DA1CB406CE6C4C62A3BFD9E00DDC2ACC.description: Transcription & Handwriting Fluency This progression ends in 2nd grade.

D71E7AC038D2470ABD38DBA1F060B402.description: Motor Skills & Letter/Word Formation This progression ends in 2nd grade.

E3EC8C0C013C472FA2F9E03072336543.description: Handwriting Students develop handwriting skills in cursive.

73F57FED6A3C4C52A415428732772A98.description: Self-correct while reading grade-level text (silently or aloud) to aid comprehension and fluency, rereading as necessary.

69BB99AC804F46D79E4C8EA73E3211DC.description: Read a wide range of grade-level texts aloud with accurate and automatic prosody (phrasing, expression, juncture/pause, and intonation) to aid comprehension.

B1CAABCD50EA401B80323F2385DAA00C.description: Read a wide range of unfamiliar grade-level texts with expression to show meaning and to demonstrate an understanding of tone.

BFA7D69482A44D9BAC90E9A61DAEA41C.description: Increase sight word vocabulary by reading regularly and irregularly spelled words in isolation and context with accuracy and automaticity. ​

1EE300A8FAC7405D840F0B15413BF5EC.description: Oral & Silent Reading Fluency Demonstrate oral and silent reading fluency to read grade-level texts for understanding, self-correcting as necessary to ensure accuracy and aid comprehension.

68600B1DAA514C579CA7AE84FD77BE8B.description: Fluency Students read texts aloud or silently with speed, accuracy, and expression.

835ED681DF194BBD8BE1E358997F723C.description: Decode and encode words with common prefixes and suffixes.

2D32DB978C1A40869911E3F280002856.description: Decode and encode single-syllable and multisyllabic words of all syllable types.

F26DE7E6AB68446094B66CAFE3079686.description: Decode and encode words with graphemes that represent multiple letter-sound correspondences.

02EC714F5D184B69A3EB3EE7FEFD34ED.description: Decoding & Encoding with Phonics Use knowledge of phonics to decode and encode grade-level words.

4A6D5A38ECDA43D89E7BD67D3A2B1193.description: Encoding with Phonics This standard only applies to the K-2 grade band.

9BE00B1051DF4B2F893ED8A9A5006DA6.description: Decoding with Phonics This standard only applies to the K-2 grade band.

FDD16EA966554E11BA8CC331CD0D32D0.description: Phoneme-Grapheme Correspondences This standard only applies to the K-2 grade band.

26E4CD326564438CAAA59285A088A6EF.description: Phonics Students learn the relationships between the sounds of spoken language and the letters of written language as they decode and encode words in context and in isolation.

CCD985A18159422E81459437BD7A3BF8.description: Concepts of Print This big idea only applies to the K-2 grade band.

23D81BD6945B4D40BE02202392535B55.description: Phonological Awareness This big idea only applies to the K-2 grade band.

C31665B1F7C044E49C3A3C7E9A658BD1.description: DOMAIN: Foundations (F) Students build a foundation for achieving dynamic literacy practices to aid reading comprehension.
